Main Menu Facebook Instagram Twitter LinkedIn Rediscovering the Gulfarium: Okaloosa Island’s Marine Adventure Park January 11, 2024 Nestled along the sun-kissed shores of Okaloosa Island in Fort Walton Beach stands a timeless treasure – the Gulfarium Marine and Adventure Park . When its doors opened in 1955, the Gulfarium wasn’t just another attraction but a gateway to the marine life prevalent along the Emerald Coast. Back then, a visit required just a single dollar bill for adults and half that for children, and families eagerly waited in line for a glimpse into this mysterious underwater world. The tremendous growth in tourism over the years has seen the Gulfarium expand its offerings repeatedly, all while remaining dedicated to its core mission of marine education and conservation. Recently renovated, the new and improved Gulfarium offers a fresh experience that’s a delightful blend of excitement, education, and a whole new level of marine adventure! What is the Gulfarium on Okaloosa Island A renowned marine park and aquarium, the Gulfarium on Okaloosa Island has been a staple in the community for years. In those early days, long before Fort Walton Beach became the vacation destination it is today, the Gulfarium was nestled on a lonely stretch of beach overlooking the Gulf of Mexico. Beyond rays and sea turtles, visitors were mesmerized by the Living Sea aquarium exhibit showcasing our very own bottlenose dolphins. A fun way for locals to spend an afternoon away from the beach , the Gulfarium offered a chance to learn about local marine life through fun exhibits and dolphin shows. Evolving over the years, the Gulfarium holds a lengthy list of firsts under its belt, from being one of the first to adopt SCUBA equipment for live shark feeding demonstrations in the 1950s to introducing the Porpoise College for training dolphins in the 1960s to developing a synthetic milk formula for bottlenose dolphins that’s still in use today. Adding additional habitats and exhibits to showcase otters, sea lions, seals, and more over the years, the facility now boasts interactive experiences, educational programs, and a host of exhibits, allowing guests to engage more intimately with marine life and the environment. Today, the facility offers captivating dolphin shows, interactive touch tanks, behind-the-scenes tours, and conservation-focused initiatives, making it an even more enriching experience for all visiting! Things to Do at the Gulfarium General admission at the Gulfarium includes entrance to all exhibits, dolphin and sea lion shows, and animal chats. Be sure to swing by the C.A.R.E. Center, a non-profit focused on sea turtle rescue, rehabilitation, and coastal conservation efforts, and the Expedition Trail, showcasing a delightful assortment of reptiles, including alligators, tortoises, and turtles. Animal Encounters are curated programs where guests can get up close and personal with the park’s resident animals under the guidance of trained professionals— a hit with kids and adults alike! Learn about the natural habitats, behaviors, and conservation efforts of dolphins, sting rays, turtles, penguins, and more through personal interaction with these amazing creatures. Those 13 and older can spend the morning as a VIP trainer, working side-by-side with trainers to learn more about what goes into taking care of the marine animal residents. And anyone who loves surprises will enjoy Mystery Adventure, which includes a chance to meet a mystery animal and a private, after-hours park tour! What’s New at the Gulfarium The Gulfarium’s latest edition, the Dolphin Oasis, is a sprawling complex comprised of three interconnected habitats, over a million gallons of saltwater, and split-level viewing to observe the dolphins above and below the water. Over a year in construction, this remarkable sanctuary is yet another evolution, seamlessly integrating into the Gulfarium footprint and signifying a leap forward in the park’s commitment to animal welfare. Replacing the original dolphin environment built over 65 years ago, Dolphin Oasis offers a modernized living space that supports the social nature of these intelligent, playful creatures. The habitats in the new design mirror the dolphin’s natural environment. Varying in depth, each flows seamlessly into the next, encouraging the social groupings vital to their well-being. An additional suite serves as a nursery for mothers and calves, and distinct locations throughout provide staff and guests opportunities to interact with the dolphins. With seating for 480 visitors, the dynamic addition promises an engaging and educational experience for visitors of all ages . Whether visiting with your family, booking a private birthday party, or reserving space for a wedding , celebration, or special event, the Gulfarium promises a unique experience for any occasion! Things to Do Near the Gulfarium After a fun day at the Gulfarium on Okaloosa Island, you’ll find several places nearby for even more fun exploration! Take a short walk to the beach to the Okaloosa Island Pier , take in the incredible views of the Gulf, and see local anglers in action. Located next door to the Gulfarium, The Boardwalk is a fun place to explore, with waterfront restaurants serving fresh seafood and fun shops for browsing. Grab some coffee, hang out on the picnic tables, and take in the views of the Gulf of Mexico while the kids play in the sand! Wild Willie’s Adventure Zone is just across the street and a great place to let the kids burn up some energy. With laser tag, bumper boats, go-karts, and more, it’s an ideal spot for plenty of family-friendly entertainment. Whether teeing up Okaloosa National Mini Golf and Ice Cream , browsing the shops in downtown Fort Walton Beach, or booking an excursion in the nearby Destin harbor, you can hit it all in one seamless trip! Of course, if you book with Scenic Stays , you can be within walking distance of the Gulfarium and near all the action on Okaloosa Island in Fort Walton Beach. Start planning your getaway today for a fun-filled, sun-filled vacation the kids will remember for years! Not valid for existing reservations. ** More information here Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park 1010 Miracle Strip Pkwy SE Fort Walton Beach, FL 32548 (850) 243-9046 This marine animal park that draws countless visitors for its fascinating exhibits and up-close animal encounters that allow you and your guests to experience the wonders of the ocean firsthand. To learn more information about why you and your guests should visit Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park during your stay in Fort Walton Beach, read on below! Learn about the Ocean and See Its Creatures Up-Close Situated on Okaloosa Island, Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is a marine themed amusement park that showcases a variety of the ocean’s most famous residents, from playful dolphins who perform in shows to majestic stingrays who swim alongside you. Beyond the incredible animals you can visit here, the exhibits teach visitors about the natural environment and ocean conservation efforts. The admission fees at Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park range from about $16.00 to nearly $24.00 for general admission, depending on age. Military discounts are also available depending on age, costing between just over $14.00 to about $21.00. Children ages 2 years old or younger are admitted for free. General admission includes access to exhibits, training demonstrations, shows, and even up-close encounters with dolphins, seals, reptiles, stingrays, sea lions, and alligators if you sign up before or during your visit. Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is open all year long, with varying hours depending on the season. The park opens daily at 9:00am, but closes at 3:30pm during the fall and winter seasons and closes at 4:30pm during the spring and summer. Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is only closed for Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. You’ll encounter Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park about a quarter of a mile east of Brooks Bridge at 1010 Miracle Strip Pkwy SE, Fort Walton Beach, FL 32548. You can also find out more about this incredible attraction by calling (850) 243-9046, emailing info@gulfarium.com , or speaking with one of our representatives at Breakers of Fort Walton Beach. Fun Activities to Enjoy Nearby While a trip to the Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is a great way to get inspired by the amazing marine animals that call this area home while having tons of fun too, guests will find that this part of Fort Walton Beach host a variety of other destinations to explore as well. Half the fun of a trip this direction is discovering and experiencing all that Fort Walton Beach has to offer. When you can’t wait to round out that exciting itinerary after an afternoon of marine education, be sure to add the following to the list of must-try activities. Browse our Short-Term Rentals in Fort Walton Beach Here! Wild Willy’s Adventure Zone Located at 1306 Miracle Strip Parkway SE, Wild Willy’s Adventure Zone is a must for those visitors to Fort Walton Beach that are enjoying time away with the entire family. When you’re on the hunt for outdoor and indoor fun, this is the place to be. Wild Willy’s Adventure Zone is a non-stop entertainment center that provides opportunities to enjoy everything from mini-golf and indoor arcade games to roller coasters that are sure to thrill. Indulge in the extravagant, if not vibrant décor before heading over to take your turn on the go-karts. Okaloosa Fishing Pier For a more tranquil experience that comes with an unbeatable view, visitors will want to make their way to the iconic Okaloosa Fishing Pier. Extending out over the scenic waters, the Okaloosa Fishing Pier is the perfect choice when you’re looking to enjoy an afternoon stroll that comes with options for soaking up the scenery and people-watching too. If you’re an angler that’s looking for a place to cast a line in the early morning hours, this would be it. Saltwater fishing is the activity of choice as the sun rises, long before the afternoon crowds make their way in the name of farmers’ markets or bird spotting. John Beasley Park Sitting at 1550 Miracle Strip Parkway SE, John Beasley Park beckons to visitors who are looking to make the most of a beachside afternoon of fun. This scenic and welcoming destination is dotted with pavilions and tables, perfect for those that are planning to enjoy time having a picnic under the Florida sunshine. Plenty of nearby parking makes John Beasley Park easy to access while the dune walkovers are a must, particularly if you’re hoping to capture some beautiful shots on film. As an added convenience to visitors, John Beasley Park hosts restrooms and changing rooms-helpful when your time here involves a dip in the water. Give Us a Call Today and Find Out More About Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park! Does visiting Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park sound like a blast? Then call or email us to discuss booking your stay in one of our incredible vacation rental properties today and take advantage of all this and more! Coming with your family to Fort Walton Beach? Explore Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park: Ultimate Marine Life Experience | Destin Dreamers Skip to main content 850-220-1674 My Rentals Recently Viewed (0) Vacation Rentals Search All Rentals Specials Search by Type Beachfront Private Pool Destin Pet Friendly Rentals Corporate Retreat Golf Cart Included Walk to the Beach Search by Area 30A Destin/Miramar Beach Luxury Rentals Search by Bedrooms 4-5 Bedroom Luxury Vacation Home 6-7 Bedroom Vacation Rentals 8+ Bedroom Free Excursions Homeowners Local Guide Explore the Destin Area Beaches and Parks Dining Family Activities Golf Courses Blog About About Us Contact Us Reviews & Stories {{select.label}} {{select.label}} {{option.name}} Search Explore Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park: Ultimate Marine Life Experience Located in Fort Walton Beach, Florida, Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park offers visitors an unforgettable opportunity to explore the fascinating world of marine life. Moreover if you’re a wildlife enthusiast, a family on vacation, or someone looking for a unique. Hands-on experience, Gulfarium provides a one-of-a-kind adventure that combines education, conservation, and fun. Discover the Fascinating Marine Life Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is home to a wide variety of marine species, from playful dolphins and majestic sea lions to colorful fish and fascinating reptiles. Visitors can observe these incredible animals in carefully designed habitats that replicate their natural environments, making it easy to learn about each species’ behaviors and characteristics. Whether you’re watching a dolphin performance or seeing sea turtles up close, Gulfarium offers an educational yet entertaining experience for all ages. After a fun day at the park, consider booking a vacation home nearby , where you can relax in comfort and enjoy the convenience of being close to all the exciting attractions. Interactive Experiences One of the highlights of Gulfarium is the opportunity to get up close and personal with some of the marine life. The park offers interactive programs where visitors can touch and feed sea creatures like stingrays, starfish, and even dolphins. If you’re seeking a more thrilling adventure, consider booking a “Swim with Dolphins” experience, where you can get into the water with these incredible creatures and interact with them in a safe, controlled environment. It’s a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to learn firsthand about these majestic animals while building lasting memories. After your exciting day, relax in a pet-friendly home nearby, where your furry friends are also welcome to join in the fun and comfort of your vacation! Educational Presentations and Shows Throughout the day, Gulfarium hosts various animal presentations that highlight the behaviors and conservation efforts of the park’s animals. These shows are not only entertaining but also educational, providing insight into marine life conservation, animal care, and the park’s role in protecting ocean ecosystems. The dolphin and sea lion shows are especially popular. Additionally as they showcase the intelligence and playful nature of these animals through a series of exciting stunts and tricks. Conservation Efforts Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is deeply committed to marine life conservation. The park plays an important role in educating the public about the challenges that marine animals face in the wild, such as habitat loss, pollution, and climate change. Gulfarium partners with various marine research organizations to help protect marine ecosystems and animals. Through their exhibits, presentations, and interactions, the park inspires visitors to take an active role in preserving the world’s oceans. Perfect for All Ages Gulfarium is a family-friendly destination that appeals to visitors of all ages. Children will love the interactive animal experiences and colorful displays, while adults can enjoy the educational aspects of the park. The park is designed to be easy to navigate, ensuring that families can enjoy their visit together without feeling rushed. There are also plenty of opportunities for memorable photos, so don’t forget to capture the fun moments with your loved ones. For a comfortable stay, consider booking a family- friendly vacation rental nearby, where everyone can relax and enjoy a cozy, convenient home away from home after a day of adventure. Conclusion Gulfarium Marine Adventure Park is the ultimate destination for anyone looking to experience marine life in a fun, interactive, and educational setting. From thrilling animal encounters to fascinating educational presentations, Gulfarium offers something for everyone. Whether you’re a local resident or a vacationer, make sure to visit Gulfarium for a unique and unforgettable adventure that brings you closer to the incredible creatures that inhabit our oceans. For a comfortable and convenient stay, consider booking a vacation rental like Destin Dreamers , where you can relax and unwind after an exciting day of exploration.
